text: is a Japanese city in Nagasaki Prefecture on the island of Kyushu.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Saga no Ran" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 826. It has been recognized as a special city since 2001.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research (2011), Table 3 ; retrieved 2012-12-18. ==History== In 1866, Sasebo was established as a major port for the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN). Sasebo became an American Naval base in 1945. Today it is the center of a military district of the or JMSDF. Harvard University, Fairbanks Center for Chinese Studies , "Recent Developments in China's Naval Modernization and Foreign Policy Activism," April 2011; retrieved 2011-12-11. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Sasebo Tourist Information site in English Category:Cities in Nagasaki Prefecture
